ExternalReferences.DisorderMappingRelation: NTBT (ORPHA code's Narrower Term maps to a Broader Term)

TextSection.Contents: Immunodeficiency with factor H anomaly is a rare genetic primary immunodeficiency disease characterized by increased susceptibility to recurrent usually severe infections (particularly by Neisseria meningitidis Escherichia coli and Haemophilus influenzae) renal impairment and/or autoimmune diseases typically manifesting with otitis media bronchitis meningitis and/or septicemia as well as hematuria/proteinuria asthma nephrotic syndrome hemolytic uremic syndrome glomerulonephritis and/or systemic lupus erythematosus. Laboratory serum analysis reveals in addition to factor H deficiency decreased complement factor B properin complement C3 and terminal complement components.

Parent.Label: Immunodeficiency due to a complement regulatory deficiency
